title: Stare Decisis and Brown v Board

content.question: Which of the following scenarios exemplifies the principle of stare decisis?

choices.label: A Senator raises opposition to a proposed bill by speaking on the floor of the Senate for eight hours.
A majority opinion of the United States Supreme Court dealing with school segregation states that the decision follows the precedent established in Brown v. Board of Education of Topeka (1954).
A president orders the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) to begin an initiative to send manned spacecraft to Mars.
Four members of the United States Supreme Court agree to hear an appeal on a death penalty case from a state supreme court.

content.answer: A majority opinion of the United States Supreme Court dealing with school segregation states that the decision follows the precedent established in Brown v. Board of Education of Topeka (1954).
